moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Advanced Theory and Practices/03 PR Shaping your Narrative/Creating a Brand Guide

overview.quote: Write out your do's and don'ts as if you were explaining them to a martian child.
overview.introText: Even if you're flying solo, creating a brand guide helps maintain consistency, prevents damaging misfires, and keeps you aligned with your long-term vision as you grow.

keyTerms.definition: A document outlining how you want to come across and what you stand for, serving as your content compass.
The distinctive attitude and personality that comes through in your communication style.
Clear lines you won't cross in your content, even when tempted by views or deals.
The core principles and values that define your content creation approach and public persona.

actionPlan: Define your unique tone of voice
Review and refine your guide monthly

mainContent.title: The Power of Questions
mainContent.text: Start with fundamental questions: Who are you? What do you care about most? What are you ultimately trying to achieve? What problems does your audience face?

summaryPoints: Your answers reveal your true north

mainContent.title: The Does & Doesn'ts Framework
mainContent.text: Create clear rules using simple language. 'I do support X' and 'I don't engage with Y' gives you instant decision-making power when opportunities arise.

summaryPoints: Write it down before temptation strikes
Update as you learn and grow

mainContent.title: Defending Your Boundaries
mainContent.text: When your audience grows, opportunities and money will test your principles. Having pre-established boundaries helps you make consistent decisions under pressure.

mainContent.title: Brand Evolution Planning
mainContent.text: Consider how your social media presence connects to your three-year vision. How will other platforms and mainstream media fit into your growth strategy?

proTips.text: Your most profitable brand deals will come from alignment with your values, not from taking whatever pays most. Patience pays.
Create a 'temptation document' listing offers you've declined and why - it builds decision-making muscle for bigger opportunities.

finalWords.description: Review it quarterly to ensure it still reflects who you are becoming.
